oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ann Lister interview
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lister, Ann
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
Ann Lister was a staff member and administrator, with secretarial and recordkeeping responsibilities and service as financial Controller, in the American University in Cairo’s Philadelphia and then New York offices from 1920 to 1965. She describes AUC’s Board of Trustees and individual members, including their roles, personalities, and religious background. She offers a portrait of President and founder Charles Watson and other administrators. These include personnel like Herman Lum, Worth Howard, and others based in the Philadelphia and New York offices and responsible for hiring, fundraising, and other tasks. She provides additional detail about the offices and their functioning as well.
There is no audio for this oral history.
